<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// When there is external, uninstrumented code writing to memory, the shadow</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// memory can get out of sync with the application memory. Enabling this flag</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// emits consistency checks for loads to catch this situation.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// When everything is instrumented, this is not strictly necessary because any</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// load should have a corresponding store, but can help debug cases when the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// framework did a bad job at tracking shadow memory modifications by failing on</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// load rather than store.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// TODO: provide a way to resume computations from the FT value when the load</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// is inconsistent. This ensures that further computations are not polluted.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// LLVM may store constant floats as bitcasted ints.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// It&#39;s not really necessary to shadow such stores,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// if the shadow value is unknown the framework will re-extend it on load</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// anyway. Moreover, because of size collisions (e.g. bf16 vs f16) it is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// impossible to determine the floating-point type based on the size.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// However, for debugging purposes it can be useful to model such stores.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127" lineLink="#ac63bbf6a012bb9fbca1a6ad93de6c135"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cl/opt">cl::opt&lt;bool&gt;</a> <a href="#ac63bbf6a012bb9fbca1a6ad93de6c135">ClPropagateNonFTConstStoresAsFT</a>(</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Propagate non floating-point const stores as floating point values.&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;For debugging purposes only&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">),</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/cl/#a68075925a54790e71ca790e1d4f21a40a263ac008d8d31f13ce460395fc4cf7e6">cl::Hidden</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00508" /><CodeLine lineNumber="508"><Highlight kind="normal">  Attr = Attr.addFnAttribute(Ctx, Attribute::NoUnwind);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00509" /><CodeLine lineNumber="509"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42;PtrTy = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pointertype/#af8a1dbdbfd89aa4899b3c0d39495d0dd">PointerType::getUnqual</a>(Ctx);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00510" /><CodeLine lineNumber="510"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42;VoidTy = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type/#a6e20e76960d952de088354cbcd14c3ab">Type::getVoidTy</a>(Ctx);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00511" /><CodeLine lineNumber="511"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/integertype">IntegerType</a> &#42;IntptrTy = M.getDataLayout().getIntPtrType(Ctx);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00512" /><CodeLine lineNumber="512"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/functiontype">FunctionType</a> &#42;SizedFnTy = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00513" /><CodeLine lineNumber="513"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00514" /><CodeLine lineNumber="514"><Highlight kind="normal">  NumSizedFuncs = Sized.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref/#a85ffb6531d4cda988ea81f18d4e56fb7">size</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00515" /><CodeLine lineNumber="515"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00516" /><CodeLine lineNumber="516"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// First entry is fallback function</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00517" /><CodeLine lineNumber="517"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (NumArgs == 3) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00518" /><CodeLine lineNumber="518"><Highlight kind="normal">    Funcs.push&#95;back(</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00519" /><CodeLine lineNumber="519"><Highlight kind="normal">        M.getOrInsertFunction(Fallback, Attr, VoidTy, PtrTy, PtrTy, IntptrTy));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00520" /><CodeLine lineNumber="520"><Highlight kind="normal">    SizedFnTy = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/functiontype/#af8be7844c269f201ebcee1e15048c378">FunctionType::get</a>(VoidTy, &#123;PtrTy, PtrTy&#125;, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00521" /><CodeLine lineNumber="521"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (NumArgs == 2) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00522" /><CodeLine lineNumber="522"><Highlight kind="normal">    Funcs.push&#95;back(</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00523" /><CodeLine lineNumber="523"><Highlight kind="normal">        M.getOrInsertFunction(Fallback, Attr, VoidTy, PtrTy, IntptrTy));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00524" /><CodeLine lineNumber="524"><Highlight kind="normal">    SizedFnTy = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/functiontype/#af8be7844c269f201ebcee1e15048c378">FunctionType::get</a>(VoidTy, &#123;PtrTy&#125;, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00525" /><CodeLine lineNumber="525"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00526" /><CodeLine lineNumber="526"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/errorhandling-h/#ace243f5c25697a1107cce46626b3dc94">llvm&#95;unreachable</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Unexpected value of sized functions arguments&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00527" /><CodeLine lineNumber="527"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00528" /><CodeLine lineNumber="528"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00529" /><CodeLine lineNumber="529"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> i = 0; i &lt; NumSizedFuncs; ++i)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00530" /><CodeLine lineNumber="530"><Highlight kind="normal">    Funcs.push&#95;back(M.getOrInsertFunction(Sized&#91;i&#93;, SizedFnTy, Attr));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00531" /><CodeLine lineNumber="531"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00532" /><CodeLine lineNumber="532"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00533" /><CodeLine lineNumber="533" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-numericalstabilitysanitizer-cpp-/nsanmemopfn/#a79f46f68b1352b4d6948f62171edf85b"><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/functioncallee">FunctionCallee</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-numericalstabilitysanitizer-cpp-/nsanmemopfn/#a79f46f68b1352b4d6948f62171edf85b">NsanMemOpFn::getFunctionFor</a>(uint64&#95;t MemOpSize)</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00534" /><CodeLine lineNumber="534"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Now &#96;getFunctionFor&#96; operates on &#96;Funcs&#96; of size 4 (at least) and the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00535" /><CodeLine lineNumber="535"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// following code assumes that the number of functions in &#96;Func&#96; is sufficient</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00536" /><CodeLine lineNumber="536"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(NumSizedFuncs &gt;= 3 &amp;&amp; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Unexpected number of sized functions&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00537" /><CodeLine lineNumber="537"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00538" /><CodeLine lineNumber="538"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Idx =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00539" /><CodeLine lineNumber="539"><Highlight kind="normal">      MemOpSize == 4 ? 1 : (MemOpSize == 8 ? 2 : (MemOpSize == 16 ? 3 : 0));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00540" /><CodeLine lineNumber="540"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00541" /><CodeLine lineNumber="541"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Funcs&#91;Idx&#93;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00542" /><CodeLine lineNumber="542"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00543" /><CodeLine lineNumber="543"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00544" /><CodeLine lineNumber="544" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-numericalstabilitysanitizer-cpp-/nsanmemopfn/#ad6b4437054ca02b52962887a24a4a526"><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/functioncallee">FunctionCallee</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-numericalstabilitysanitizer-cpp-/nsanmemopfn/#ad6b4437054ca02b52962887a24a4a526">NsanMemOpFn::getFallback</a>()</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Funcs&#91;0&#93;; &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1201"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  - (A) If the source has a shadow, we truncate from the shadow, else we</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1202"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    truncate from the original source.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1203"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  - (B) If the shadow of the source is larger than the shadow of the dest,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1205"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    type as the shadow of the dest (because mappings are non-decreasing), so</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01826" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1826"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// A non-ft store needs to invalidate shadow memory. Exceptions are:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01827" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1827"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   - memory transfers of floating-point data through other pointer types (llvm</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01828" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1828"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     optimization passes transform &#96;&#42;(float&#42;)a = &#42;(float&#42;)b&#96; into</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01829" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1829"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     &#96;&#42;(i32&#42;)a = &#42;(i32&#42;)b&#96; ). These have the same semantics as memcpy.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01830" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1830"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   - Writes of FT-sized constants. LLVM likes to do float stores as bitcasted</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01831" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1831"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     ints. Note that this is not really necessary because if the value is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01832" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1832"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     unknown the framework will re-extend it on load anyway. It just felt</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01833" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1833"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     easier to debug tests with vectors of FTs.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2013"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Moves fast math flags from the function to individual instructions, and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2014"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// removes the attribute from the function.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2015"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// TODO: Make this controllable with a flag.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2016" lineLink="#af38843c02fb1bd2a665b01306e55be43"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="#af38843c02fb1bd2a665b01306e55be43">moveFastMathFlags</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2017"><Highlight kind="normal">                              std::vector&lt;Instruction &#42;&gt; &amp;Instructions) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2018"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/fastmathflags">FastMathFlags</a> FMF;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2019"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#define MOVE&#95;FLAG(attr, setter)                                                \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2020"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">  if (F.getFnAttribute(attr).getValueAsString() == &quot;true&quot;) &#123;                   \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2021"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">    F.removeFnAttr(attr);                                                      \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2022"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">    FMF.set##setter();                                                         \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2023"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">  &#125;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2024"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="#a4d074490a86b67506cfa5e2334261faa">MOVE&#95;FLAG</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;unsafe-fp-math&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cabc8e2ee40a84687a9e12fd08784b87ba">Fast</a>)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2025"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="#a4d074490a86b67506cfa5e2334261faa">MOVE&#95;FLAG</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;no-infs-fp-math&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">, NoInfs)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2026"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="#a4d074490a86b67506cfa5e2334261faa">MOVE&#95;FLAG</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;no-nans-fp-math&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">, NoNaNs)</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2045"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector&lt;Instruction &#42;, 8&gt;</a> AllLoadsAndStores;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2046"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector&lt;Instruction &#42;, 8&gt;</a> LocalLoadsAndStores;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2047"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2048"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The instrumentation maintains:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2049"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  - for each IR value &#96;v&#96; of floating-point (or vector floating-point) type</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2050"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    FT, a shadow IR value &#96;s(v)&#96; with twice the precision 2FT (e.g.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2051"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    double for float and f128 for double).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2052"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  - A shadow memory, which stores &#96;s(v)&#96; for any &#96;v&#96; that has been stored,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2053"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    along with a shadow memory tag, which stores whether the value in the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2054"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    corresponding shadow memory is valid. Note that this might be</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2055"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    incorrect if a non-instrumented function stores to memory, or if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2056"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    memory is stored to through a char pointer.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2057"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  - A shadow stack, which holds &#96;s(v)&#96; for any floating-point argument &#96;v&#96;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2058"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    of a call to an instrumented function. This allows</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2059"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    instrumented functions to retrieve the shadow values for their</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2060"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    arguments.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2061"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    Because instrumented functions can be called from non-instrumented</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2062"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    functions, the stack needs to include a tag so that the instrumented</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2063"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    function knows whether shadow values are available for their</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2064"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    parameters (i.e. whether is was called by an instrumented function).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2065"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    When shadow arguments are not available, they have to be recreated by</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2066"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    extending the precision of the non-shadow arguments to the non-shadow</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2067"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    value. Non-instrumented functions do not modify (or even know about) the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2068"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    shadow stack. The shadow stack pointer is &#95;&#95;nsan&#95;shadow&#95;args. The shadow</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2069"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    stack tag is &#95;&#95;nsan&#95;shadow&#95;args&#95;tag. The tag is any unique identifier</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2070"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    for the function (we use the address of the function). Both variables</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2071"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    are thread local.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2072"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    Example:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2073"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     calls                             shadow stack tag      shadow stack</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2074"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     =======================================================================</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2075"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     non&#95;instrumented&#95;1()              0                     0</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2076"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//             |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2077"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//             v</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2078"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     instrumented&#95;2(float a)           0                     0</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2079"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//             |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2080"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//             v</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2081"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     instrumented&#95;3(float b, double c) &amp;instrumented&#95;3       s(b),s(c)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2082"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//             |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2083"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//             v</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2084"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     instrumented&#95;4(float d)           &amp;instrumented&#95;4       s(d)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2085"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//             |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2086"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//             v</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2087"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     non&#95;instrumented&#95;5(float e)       &amp;non&#95;instrumented&#95;5   s(e)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2088"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//             |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2089"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//             v</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2090"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     instrumented&#95;6(float f)           &amp;non&#95;instrumented&#95;5   s(e)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2091"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2092"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   On entry, instrumented&#95;2 checks whether the tag corresponds to its</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2093"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   function ptr.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2094"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   Note that functions reset the tag to 0 after reading shadow parameters.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2095"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   This ensures that the function does not erroneously read invalid data if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2096"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   called twice in the same stack, once from an instrumented function and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2097"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   once from an uninstrumented one. For example, in the following example,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2098"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   resetting the tag in (A) ensures that (B) does not reuse the same the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2099"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   shadow arguments (which would be incorrect).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2100"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//      instrumented&#95;1(float a)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2101"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//             |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2102"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//             v</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2103"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//      instrumented&#95;2(float b)  (A)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2104"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//             |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2105"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//             v</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2106"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//      non&#95;instrumented&#95;3()</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2107"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//             |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2108"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//             v</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2109"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//      instrumented&#95;2(float b)  (B)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2110"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2111"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  - A shadow return slot. Any function that returns a floating-point value</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2112"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    places a shadow return value in &#95;&#95;nsan&#95;shadow&#95;ret&#95;val. Again, because</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2113"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    we might be calling non-instrumented functions, this value is guarded</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2114"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    by &#95;&#95;nsan&#95;shadow&#95;ret&#95;tag marker indicating which instrumented function</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2115"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    placed the value in &#95;&#95;nsan&#95;shadow&#95;ret&#95;val, so that the caller can check</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2116"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    that this corresponds to the callee. Both variables are thread local.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2117"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2118"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    For example, in the following example, the instrumentation in</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2119"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    &#96;instrumented&#95;1&#96; rejects the shadow return value from &#96;instrumented&#95;3&#96;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2120"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    because is is not tagged as expected (&#96;&amp;instrumented&#95;3&#96; instead of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2121"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    &#96;non&#95;instrumented&#95;2&#96;):</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2122"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2123"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        instrumented&#95;1()</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2124"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//            |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2125"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//            v</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2126"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        float non&#95;instrumented&#95;2()</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2127"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//            |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2128"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//            v</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2129"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        float instrumented&#95;3()</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2130"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2131"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Calls of known math functions (sin, cos, exp, ...) are duplicated to call</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2132"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// their overload on the shadow type.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2133"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2134"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Collect all instructions before processing, as creating shadow values</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2135"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// creates new instructions inside the function.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2136"><Highlight kind="normal">  std::vector&lt;Instruction &#42;&gt; OriginalInstructions;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2137"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &amp;BB : <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>)</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2140"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2141"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="#af38843c02fb1bd2a665b01306e55be43">moveFastMathFlags</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>, OriginalInstructions);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2142"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-numericalstabilitysanitizer-cpp-/valuetoshadowmap">ValueToShadowMap</a> ValueToShadow(Config);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2144"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In the first pass, we create shadow values for all FT function arguments</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2145"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// and all phis. This ensures that the DFS of the next pass does not have</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2146"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// any loops.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2147"><Highlight kind="normal">  std::vector&lt;PHINode &#42;&gt; OriginalPhis;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2148"><Highlight kind="normal">  createShadowArguments(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>, TLI, ValueToShadow);</Highlight></CodeLine>
